sentences.en: His report was scathing about Loyalist and Republican terror groups.
sentences.cn: 他的报告猛烈抨击了忠英派和共和军的恐怖组织。

sentences.en: Party loyalists responded as they always do, waving flags and carrying placards.
sentences.cn: 党的忠诚支持者们一如既往地以挥舞旗帜和高举海报作为回应。

sentences.en: She was one of the greatest Loyalist proponents outside of Coruscant.
sentences.cn: 她是科洛桑之外最伟大的忠诚者之一.

sentences.en: The attack was in revenge for the deaths of two loyalist prisoners.
sentences.cn: 这次袭击是对处死两个被囚禁的忠诚分子的报复.

trans.tran_cn: 持现政权忠诚的人，（对统治者）效忠者，反对独立者，“loyal”的派生
trans.tran_en: someone who continues to support a government or country, especially during a period of change
